en.title: What Is Genetic Testing for Cats? Why Breeders Do It and What It Means
en.content:
Genetic testing is an examination that identifies the risk of hereditary diseases in cats beforehand. It is an important practice carried out by responsible breeders on their parent cats to ensure the health of their kittens.

Why Genetic Testing Is Important

Cats can have breed-specific hereditary diseases. By examining the genes of parent cats, breeders can predict the risk of diseases being passed on to kittens and develop appropriate breeding plans.

Common Test Items

PKD (Polycystic Kidney Disease), HCM (Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy), and PRA (Progressive Retinal Atrophy) are among the most common tests. The specific tests required vary by breed.

Our Approach at Fuluck Cattery

At Fuluck Cattery, we conduct genetic testing on all parent cats and maintain a sound breeding program. Test results are shared with customers upon request. By choosing a kitten from a breeder who performs genetic testing, you can minimize the risk of hereditary diseases.

zh.title: 什么是猫咪基因检测？繁育人进行基因检测的原因和意义
zh.content:
基因检测是预先了解猫咪遗传性疾病风险的检查。这是负责任的繁育人对种猫进行的一项重要工作，旨在培育健康的幼猫。

为什么基因检测很重要

猫咪存在品种特有的遗传性疾病。通过检查种猫的基因，可以预测疾病遗传给幼猫的风险，并制定合理的繁育计划。

主要检测项目

PKD（多囊肾病）、HCM（肥厚型心肌病）、PRA（进行性视网膜萎缩症）等是代表性检测项目。不同品种需要检测的项目也不同。

福楽猫舍的举措

福楽猫舍对所有种猫进行基因检测，实施健全的繁育计划。检测结果可根据需要向客户提供。选择经过基因检测的繁育人家的猫咪，可以将遗传性疾病的风险降到最低。
